attributes.title: Tim Hortons Supply Chain
attributes.description:
Brand Selected: Tim Hortons Coffee
 
Overview:  Tim Hortons is the place that Canadians go in order to intake one of the country’s favorite beverages: Coffee. The company uses 100 % Arabica beans from several of the world’s renowned coffee production regions. These regions include: Brazil, Colombia, Guatemala, and Honduras (Coffee, 2012).

This nation is recognized to be among the best coffee producers in the world. The unique clima and perfect altitude creates the perfect combination to grow and cultivate coffee. 
Just in the year 2010, Canada imported 162 million of coffee not roasted and not decaffeinated (Agrifood- Canada, 2011)
References
Agri-Food Trade Service (2011). Report Colombia. Retrieved on May 26th 2013 from http://www.ats.agr.gc.ca/lat/3854-eng.htm
attributes.title: Coffee Plantations

attributes.description:
Guatemala is another principal supplier of coffee beans into Canada. It exports 8 % of its annual production to our nation. Last year, the total amount of coffee exported was 3.72 million 60 kg bags (Guatemala Coffee Exports, 2013).
References
Guatemala Coffee Exports. Retrieved on May 26th, 2013 from http://www.guatemalancoffees.com/index.php/exports
attributes.title: Coffee Plantations

attributes.description:
Honduras is the principal exporter of coffee in Central America. They export approximately five million 60 kg bags per year. 
Tim Hortons cooperates with the trifinio region in order to provide equal benefits for both countries (Hortons, 2012). Among these benefits are donating school books, and building schools making possible the attendance of 500 children to class.
References
Tim Hortons Coffee Partnership (2012). Making a true difference in coffe growing communities. Retrieved on May 26th, 2013 from http://www.timhortons.com/ca/en/difference/coffee-partnership-our-projects-trifinio.html
attributes.title: Coffee Plantations

attributes.description: Brazil’s farms produce 25% of the world’s coffee. This makes Brazil the largest coffee predicting nation in the world. The main type of coffee produced in Brazil is Arabica. Tim Hortons coffee partnership program allows some regions in Brazil to increase the quality of their product by assisting farmers to build warehouses, as well as supporting the training of new workers. (Hortons, 2012)
attributes.title: Coffee Plantations

attributes.description:
Coffee is Canada’s favourite hot beverage. Every year, Canadians consume approximately 15 billion cups of this nectar (Coffee Association of Canada, 2012). Tim Hortons is one of the main providers of coffee to the public, with hundreds of locations across the nation. However, in order to keep up with the ever-increasing demand for this brew, the company must ensure that their coffee supply meets criteria in terms of quality, and specific shipment amounts. In addition, they must take into consideration fair trade, in which exporters can benefit from the business also (About Coffee, 2012). 
Once the Coffe is shipped into the country, it is brought to roasting facilities, in which it is toasted to meet a balanced flavor. Then it is sent to the distributions centres located in British Columbia; Alberta; Ontario (2); and Nova Scotia. Finally, it is distributed to the retail stores.
References
Coffee Association of Canada. Retrieved on May 26th, 2013 from hhtp://www.coffeeassoc.com
